text: American Motors (AMC) was an American car company. It was formed in 1954 when Nash-Kelvinator Corporation and Hudson Motor Car Company became one company. It is famous for its Javelin and AMX muscle cars. AMC bought the Jeep car company in 1970. In 1987, Chrysler bought AMC for US $1.5 billion. ==References== Category:Automobile brands Category:1954 establishments in the United States Category:1987 disestablishments in the United States Category:1950s establishments in Michigan Category:Renault
title: American Motors
